pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.14: “A bedspread” renders _uttarattharaṇa_. [Sp.1.517](): _Uttarattharaṇanti mañcakassa upari attharaṇakaṁ vuccati_, “What is spread on top of a bed is called an _uttarattharaṇa_.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.8: _Agāraṁ_ is typically rendered as "in a house". The problem with this is that it is not unallowable for a monastic to live in a building that is the equivalent of a house. What a monastic should not do is own a home and then live there.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.12: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](pli-tv-kd8:3.1.6). | According to [](pli-tv-kd8:21.1.4) this is no smaller than 8 by 4 _sugataṅgula_, “standard fingerbreadths”.
